rComments: While I definitely could have tried harder, and it was online due to Covid, his papers are extremely tough. He's a hard marker and, while his expectations are kind of clear, it doesn't mean he'll give you a good grade. He also didn't like me, which may have factored in a little bit.

Amazing person and prof- really engaging lectures. READ HIS ESSAY OUTLINES! You lose a whole letter grade if you don't follow his specific citation, format, etc. A pretty hard marker but I think he's fair tbh- just have to work hard on his essays and not last minute. Definitely one of my favourite profs- take him when you can!

Professor Serrati has been one of my favourite professors not only because of his amazing lectures but because he clearly loves his job and goes the extra mile to make sure that he has the most up to date knowledge in his presentations. His assignments aren't easy but the expectations are clear and he is easy to talk to if you are having problems.

Professor Serrati is an entertaining and interesting lecturer. You can absolutely get away with not reading the textbook. If I had paid better attention I definitely could have gotten an A. The course consists of two papers, a quiz and the final. The two papers are different, requiring you to cite 4-7 different sources at least once in few words.

Of my four years at uOttawa, Professor Serrati hands down has been the best lecturer. His lectures are very engaging and seems like a movie unfolding each lecture. Although this was a 3 hour lecture it was still slightly draining. HIGHLY RECCOMEND! Go to class, skim a few readings, know general content and youre good. Hilarious and kind man.

Dr. Serrati is a amazing lecturer, that is, enthusiastic and engaged. However, he is a extremely though grader. Be ready to read and write a lot. He doesn't give grades higher then C. If not mandatory, DO NOT take him.
